availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

creation.placeName: New York, New York County, New York

body.p:
United States of America
City County & State of New York SS

I, J. M. Guiteau the person mentioned in the commission executed January 9th 1864 by his Excellency Thomas E. Bramlette governor of Kentucky appointing me commissioner of Deeds do Solemnly Swear that I will to the best of my knowledge and ability faithfully perform all the duties of said office, and that the seal upon this paper and also the duplicate here of is my seal of office

J. M. Guiteau
J. M. GUITEAU
COMMISSIONER OF DEEDS FOR
Kentucky
NEW YORK CITY
Sworn to in duplicate this 15th day of January 1864 before me a notary Public authorized by law to administer oaths in the State of New York

William T. Fanham
Notary Public
State City County of New York

WILLIAM T. LANHAM
CITY & STATE OF NEW YORK
NOTARY PUBLIC
New York
Oath of
J. M. Guiteau
Comr of Deeds
64
